Tepić pita Vučića i Stefanovića: Kako je moguće da oružje firme GIM stoji u skladištu MUP-a na Avali

05 Nov 2019, 13:30

Potpredsednica Stranke slobode i pravde (SSP) Marinika Tepić pozvala je danas predsednika Srbije Aleksandra Vučića, ministra unutrašnjih poslova Nebojšu Stefanovića i tužilaštvo da "hitno" odgovore "kako je moguće da oružje privatne fabrike GIM, čiji je predstavnik ministrov otac, Branko Stefanović, bude smešteno u skladištu MUP-a na Avali". Pokazujući fotografije sanduka sa pištoljima i puškama na kojima je sertifikat kompanije GIM, ona je ocenila da ti "dokazi" stvaraju "osnovanu sumnju da se radi o oružju koje MUP oduzima gradjanima kako bi bilo uništeno, a umesto toga ga po bagatelnim cenama prodaje kompaniji GIM koja ga potom preprodaje za mnogo veću cenu". "Kako je moguće da oružje privatne fabrike GIM, za koju radi otac ministra unutrašnjih poslova Nebojše Stefanovića, bude smešteno u skladištu MUP-a čiji je prvi čovek upravo Nebojša Stefanović", upitala je potpredsednica Stranke slobode i pravde. Ona je novinarima u Skupštini Srbije pokazala i kopiju dokumenta iz kog se, kako je navela, "jasno vidi da je Branko Stefanović član delegacije fabrike GIM kada je sa partnerima iz Saudijske Arabije trebalo da isposluje trgovinu oružjem iz fabrike Krušik". Upitala je i ministra trgovine Rasima Ljajića "kako je bilo moguće 2017. i do septembra 2018. godine izdati dozvolu firmi GIM za trgovinu i izvoz oružja ako se zna da je to preduzeće do septembra 2018. bilo registrovano pod šifrom delatnosti 4644, odnosno trgovina na veliko porcelanom, staklenom robom i sredstvima za čišćenje". "Ovo baš i ne liči na stakleno i porcelansko oružje. Apsolutno sam sigurna da je ovo sasvim dovoljan dokaz da se tužilaštvo konačno probudi iz zimskog sna i počne da radi svoj posao", navela je Marinika Tepić.

Tepic asks Vucic and Stefanovic: How is it possible for GIM weapons to be stored in the MUP depot in Avala

05 Nov 2019, 13:30

Party of Freedom and Justice (SAA) Vice-President Marinika Tepic today called on Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic, Interior Minister Nebojsa Stefanovic and the prosecution to respond "urgently" as it is possible for the GIM private factory, whose representative is the minister's father, Branko Stefanovic. housed in the Avali MUP depot ". Showing photos of GIM-certified pistols and shotguns, she said that this "evidence" creates "reasonable suspicion that it was a weapon that was seized by the MUP to be destroyed, and instead sold to GIM at bargain prices. which then resells it for a much higher price. " "How is it possible for the weapons of the private GIM factory, for which the father of Interior Minister Nebojsa Stefanovic works, to be stored in a MUP depot whose first man is precisely Nebojsa Stefanovic," asked the vice president of the Freedom and Justice Party. She also showed reporters at the Serbian Parliament a copy of a document from which she stated "clearly sees Branko Stefanovic as a member of the GIM factory delegation when it was supposed to trade arms with the Saudi Arabian counterparts at the Krusik factory." She also asked Trade Minister Rasim Ljajic "how it was possible in 2017 and by September 2018 to issue a license to GIM for trade and export of weapons if it is known that by September 2018 that company was registered under activity code 4644, that is, trade on wholesale of porcelain, glassware and cleaning products ". "This is not exactly like glass and porcelain weapons. I am absolutely sure that this is enough proof that the prosecution finally wakes up from a hibernation and begins to do its job," said Marinika Tepic.
